title: Internal file permissions for thunderbird - error "unable to write the email to the mailbox"
content:

Every operation that moves or downloads messages fails and the common thread seems to be permission to write to various folders: -downloading messages unable to write email to the Mail box -sending messages cannot put the outgoing message into the sent box -Deleting messages cannot put the email into the trash folder

These events all produce windows with explanations of the perceived problem. One example attached.

This user has "full Control" permission on Thunderbird folders, but Thunderbird cannot write to the folders from within Thunderbird.

The inbox folder and the trash folders have been repaired.

Outside Thunderbird the User can write a .txt file to all folders down to and including the pop.[provider name] folder.

The latest version of Thunderbird (128.8.1esr(32-bit)) has been downloaded and installed. Thunderbird has been restarted and the problem continues.

There is plenty of disk space.

The operating system is Windows 10.

Sure would appreciate some guidance to get this working.

Bob

title: GMAIL - Spostamento messaggi su cartelle LOCAL - Non le cancella dal server
content: Buongiorno, ho installato thunderbird, configurato GMAIL, replicato messaggi e creato cartelle per l'archiviazione in locale. Obiettivo: liberare spazio su GMAIL, spostando le mail dal server centrale a cartelle locali, su altri client di posta questa operazione comporta l'automatica cancellazione dal server ma con GMAIL non è successo. Aggiungo che ho fatto questa operazione spostando (mi ha chiesto proprio il comando esplicito) da INBOX e non da ALLMAIL. VIceversa ho visto che spostando le mail nel cestino e cancellandole definitivamente, sul server vengono effettivamente cancellate. La domanda è quindi: per cancellarle sul serve, questo secondo metodo è l'unico? Non c'è un modo per dirgli che lo spostamento in cartelle locali (che comporta la rimozione dalla inbox) comporta anche automaticamente la cancellazione dal server? Grazie in anticipo per il vostro supporto Saluti Mattia Cattaneo

title: Thunderbird renders images too large - ignoring the defined height (ongoing issue, at least since version 128.7.1esr)
content:
Hi everyone,

We've been experiencing an issue with image rendering in Thunderbird for quite some time. Since at least version 128.7.1esr (and possibly earlier), images in emails are displayed at their maximum size, ignoring the defined height. When you resize the email window in Thunderbird, you can see, that the height of the image is switchting between the defined height and ignoring the height.

This issue occurs only in Thunderbird—other email clients and webmail services display the images in our mails correctly. Originally, we used the following code in our signature in our company:

Since Thunderbird seems to ignore the height attribute, we started using a style declaration with "!important" as a workaround:

This problem affects any embedded images in emails.

Has anyone else encountered this issue or knows when this will be fixed? Any insights would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

title: Hide Pics for Image-Only Spam messages in Thunderbird
content:
I've long blocked remote images in my Thunderbird messages, and I have pretty good spam filtering at both server and app level, but when spam gets through it's invariably of the "image only" type. That is, an image with the product/scam/junk text and stuff all within the graphic.

Even though I have the Reading & Display setting of "View attachments inline" NOT checked, and the Files & Attachment settings for content type of JPEG Image and PNG Image (and everything else) all set to "Always Ask" –  STILL the images are shown to me when I select the spam message for deletion.

I can't be the only one getting image-based spam, so I'm a bit surprised that I can't find a solution to simply not display image attachments. I do still want to see the original HTML (many emails are a mess in plaintext only), but is there no means to keep the formatting but simply not load & show images?

Again - this is not about REMOTE images, rather image attachments.

Thx if anyone has some input

title: Reverting to threaded messages
content:
I'm using the latest update of Thunderbird on a Windows 11 machine. This issue has been present since I started using TB sometime last year, so through various updates.

I set most of my folders, especially those used regularly (inbox, sent, trash, etc.) to unthreaded, which does sort the messages unthreaded. (Some folders I use so infrequently I haven't bothered to change them)

However, in many cases (mostly excluding the inbox), the folder reverts to threaded and I have to do it all over again.

Not the end of the world, but aggravating.

In an ideal world, I'd set ALL of my folders to unthreaded and probably leave them all there forever. (Although the option to switch on the fly does seem nice and conceivably, I might use it). Reading previous threads, I'm assuming that this needs to be done folder by folder. But what I have NOT seen is why folders which have been changed revert to threaded. I haven't figured out any pattern to it; reversions don't happen every time, so they appear to be rather random.

P.S. I have 2 email accounts and at various times, I've had to delete and re-install both of them. For one, it happens with some frequency, for the other, much less so. But I'm pretty certain that there is no correlation between the problem described and reloading the accounts. And I'm also pretty certain that it occurs from time to time in folders which store emails which are independent of either account and not online.

title: Calendar .vcs invitations being treated as text, not functioning, when Google Calendar enabled
content:
One of the best things about Thunderbird is that it has been compatible with the Outlook-style .vcs calendar invite attachments ever since Lightning. Now it's integral. Until this week it was great -- I get a lot of meeting invites via calendar attachments, and a fair number of cancellations too. When I clicked on the mail I got a dialog box asking if I wanted to add or delete the meeting, or saying that it already has been.

But suddenly it's not working. (This is using 128.6.esr and then 128.8.1.) Instead, the decoded text of the invite is now being displayed as a text message, and it doesn't give me any way to add or delete the invite unless I do it manually. The attachment is not being processed.

The problem seems somehow related to Provider for Google Calendar. I use that so my phone can make calendar entries. It has worked for years with no problem, but the problem I'm describing goes away if I disable Provider for Google Calendar, in which case I don't see a lot of events entered that way, or set it to read only, in which case I can't enter things my cell phone can see, which I used to be able to do. Yeah, I sure wish the two calendar systems could be better integrated so my cell phone could see the Home calendar or the attachments could be directed to Google Calendar, but no go.

A few days ago, my Home calendar disappeared from T'bird, leaving only the Google one visible. I re-enabled it and everything came back, but the attachments don't work when everything is normally enabled. Maybe that's related. Suggestions?
creator: fred37

title: INBOX showing zero messages

I Have always left messages on the server, so everything is there (about 40,000 messages). But I need them locally on the laptop where I can organize them and search, etc. Starting over from scratch is daunting and will make me look for another email client that won't wreck years of work.
